newsitem.title: USA: Envirodyne gets $652 million takeover bid.
newsitem.headline: Envirodyne gets $652 million takeover bid.

text.p: Envirodyne Industries Inc. said Thursday it has received a takeover offer worth about $652 million from a director and a former chairman of the food packaging and foodservice supplies company.

The cash bid of $8.50 a share is being made through HK Acquisitions Corp., which was formed by Michael Heisley, a director of Envirodyne, and Donald Kelly, the company's former chairman, president and chief executive.
The purchase price includes about $127 million in cash for equity and the assumption of $525 million of debt, it said.
Envirodyne's stock rose 93.75 cents to $8.1875 on Nasdaq.
Envirodyne said the offer was made in a letter requiring a response from the company by June 18.
Envirodyne must pay HK Acquisitions a $10 million fee if it agrees to be acquired and then calls off the deal due to an alternative transaction.
In May, Zapata Corp. said it terminated its $8 a share proposal to acquire all of Envirodyne's common stock that it did not already own.
A spokesman for the Oak Brook, Ill.-based company said Envirodyne has no other pending acquisition offers.
Envirodyne said HK Acquisition's bid will be submitted to a committee of independent directors, which will evaluate it and make a recommendation to the board of directors.
The deal is subject to negotiation and execution of a definitive agreement, approval by the board and stockholders of Envirodyne, and antitrust regulatory approval.

Envirodyne's principal subsidiaries are Viskase Corp., Clear Shield National Inc. and Sandusky Plastics Inc. They make meat packaging products; heat shrinkable plastic bags and speciality plastic films; disposable plastic cutlery, drinking straws and custom dining kits; and plastic containers for cultured dairy products.
